main_definition: Aboriginal refers to the original or earliest known inhabitants of a particular region, especially indigenous peoples.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to the first inhabitants of an area, particularly in Australia and New Zealand
meanings_and_examples.example: The Aboriginal people have unique traditions and cultures that are integral to their identity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Pertaining to indigenous or original peoples who were living on a land before colonization or modern settlement occurred
meanings_and_examples.example: Aboriginal rights refer to the legal recognition of native peoples' claim over lands traditionally occupied by them.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refers to the earliest known group or people in history who inhabited a specific region before any other groups moved there
meanings_and_examples.example: The aboriginal tribes of North America were among the first inhabitants on this continent.
